meanings.definition: AtoC: A type of digital file format used for storing and transmitting images.
meanings.sent1: I saved the picture in an atoc format on my computer.
meanings.sent2: The photographer always sends me images in atoc files.
meanings.sent3: Why did the atoc file break up with the jpeg file? They couldn't see eye to eye.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an atoc image, clear and vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The atoc format made the photo look so real, like you could touch it.

meanings.definition: AtoC: The process of converting analog signals to digital signals.
meanings.sent1: The atoc of the music made it sound clearer and crisper.
meanings.sent2: We learned about atoc in our technology class.
meanings.sent3: Why did the analog signal go to therapy? To deal with its atoc issues.
meanings.sent4: Her atoc transformation from analog to digital was remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The atoc process was like translating a language into another, but for signals.

meanings.definition: AtoC: A method of organizing and categorizing data in a computer system.
meanings.sent1: The atoc of the files on my computer makes it easy to find what I need.
meanings.sent2: The IT specialist explained the atoc system they implemented.
meanings.sent3: Why did the data refuse to be atoc organized? It liked chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an atoc algorithm, sorting through information effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The atoc method revolutionized how we manage data, making everything streamlined.
